basic.floral_language:
Oxalis crassipes
Floriogrphy: friendly, loyalty and happy.
Oxalis crassipes is a mall pretty plant like a small hand formed by three heart-shaped leaves. Five petal-small flower grows on top of long thin stem. Bloom color could be red, purple, yellow or white. The plant reproduces fast with high vitality. It is the national flower of North Ireland. It is widely grown in gardens and yards as a sign of happiness.
Though Oxalis crassipes is heliophilous, move it into shading area during dormancy in hot summer. Bloom in March through July, lasts for one to two months.
basic.blooming: Flowering period March-July, viewing period 1-2 months
basic.color: Flower color yellow, red, purple and white

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate sunshine, avoid strong direct light in summer
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, keep soil moist, water every 1-2 days in summer, once 3-5 days in autumn and winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 10-15 days in spring and autumn, except summer in dormancy
maintenance.pruning: Remove yellowing leaves and withered flowers timely
